metadata.name: AWS IAM S3Browser Templated S3 Bucket Policy Creation
metadata.comment: Detects S3 browser utility creating Inline IAM policy containing default S3 bucket name placeholder value of "<YOUR-BUCKET-NAME>".

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM api_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('iam.amazonaws.com') AND lower(api.operation) = lower('putuserpolicy') AND contains(lower(http_request.user_agent), lower('s3 browser')) AND lower(api.request.data) regexp '.*"arn:aws:s3:::<your-bucket-name>/.*".*' AND contains(lower(api.request.data), lower('"s3:getobject"')) AND contains(lower(api.request.data), lower('"allow"')))

output.summary: Detects S3 browser utility creating Inline IAM policy containing default S3 bucket name placeholder value of "<YOUR-BUCKET-NAME>".

metadata.objective: False positive: Valid usage of S3 browser with accidental creation of default Inline IAM policy without changing default S3 bucket name placeholder value Reference: https://permiso.io/blog/s/unmasking-guivil-new-cloud-threat-actor
